definition: variant of 折中[zhe2 zhong1]
to break (e.g. stick or bone)/a loss

to break/to fracture/to snap/to suffer loss/to bend/to twist/to turn/to change direction/convinced/to convert into (currency)/discount/rebate/tenth (in price)/classifier for theatrical scenes/to fold/accounts book
to turn sth over/to turn upside down/to tip sth out (of a container)
inner feelings
eclecticism
Eclectus roratus (red-green parrot of Papua-New Guinea)

sentences.english: Finally, he incorporated some compromises suggested by others into a specific motion.
sentences.chinese: 最後，他整合了一些各個方面建議，得出折衷議案。

sentences.english: This was a period of great eclecticism.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個重要的折衷主義的時期。

sentences.english: The Singaporeans argue that they have the perfect compromise between accountability and efficiency.
sentences.chinese: 新加坡人稱他們在責任與效率之間達成了最好的折衷。

sentences.english: In that way, it is eclectic.
sentences.chinese: 從那個角度講，它是折衷的。

sentences.english: And many, of course, will not even accept these temporary compromises.
sentences.chinese: 當然，大多數甚至都不會接受這個暫時的折衷。

sentences.english: It must provide a forum for public criticism and compromise.
sentences.chinese: 新聞必須成爲社會批評與折衷的論壇。

sentences.english: I believe we need a balanced approach.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲我們需要一個折衷方案。

sentences.english: He teamed with Chinese Premier Wen Jiabao to draft a late-night compromise.
sentences.chinese: 他和中國總理溫家寶連夜共同起草了一份折衷協定。

sentences.english: It is an eclectic mix of Japanese tea drinking and English country garden.
sentences.chinese: 它是日本茶道和英國鄉村花園折衷。

sentences.english: This is a valid concern, and also where the trade-off game starts.
sentences.chinese: 這是合理的擔憂，並且也是需要開始考慮折衷的地方。

sentences.english: This tradeoff allows the framework to drastically speed up application development.
sentences.chinese: 這個折衷允許框架大幅度加快應用程序開發的速度。

sentences.english: Swearing wa invented a a compromise etwee ruing away and fighting.
sentences.chinese: 詛咒是逃跑和打架之間的一種折衷。

sentences.english: If you go this way, then you know that this is the tradeoff.
sentences.chinese: 如果你繼續這樣下去，你就會明白這就是設計折衷。

sentences.english: Partially alloyed powders are a compromise approach.
sentences.chinese: 部分合金粉末是一種折衷的方法。

sentences.english: The compromise was a face-saver for all concerned.
sentences.chinese: 折衷是一個能讓所有相關人士保全顏面的辦法。

sentences.english: Swearing was invented as a compromise between running away and fighting.
sentences.chinese: 發明詛咒是把它作爲逃跑和打架之間的一種折衷。

definition: to compromise/to take the middle road/a trade-off/eclectic
expedient
to consider (a matter)/to deliberate
difference/discrepancy
harmonious/to mediate/to reconcile/to compromise/mediation/to mix/to blend/blended/to season/seasoning/to placate
to discuss (a plan)/to negotiate (an outcome)
to continue the same old routine/to carry on just as before/to procrastinate
to adopt (a system, policy, strategy etc)
disagreement/differing interpretations
divide and rule (strategy)/divide and conquer
to revere the past and despise the present (idiom)
to seek common ground, putting differences aside (idiom)
high sounding and impractical/high flown nonsense
to discuss/to bring up various ideas for discussion
to revise (text, plan etc)
to bear in mind
